title: What is the best song that lasts under one minute? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s so Obvious by Wire (57secs), from their debut which has half a dozen tracks under a minute.  Medac by The Who (58secs), written by John Entwistle and featured on one the best albums from 1967 Who Sell Out, this is a mock advertisement, in line with this album’s overall radio concept.  Casbah Rock by the Undertones (45secs) - a homage to the shebeen where they played pre fame.  A Little Bit of Soap - De La Soul (57secs) Now I'm not all about dissing someone else personnel But there's no quota on your odor That's right, you smell  Straight Edge - Minor Threat (45secs) rejecting all drugs as a lifestyle choice. I'm a person just like youBut I've got better things to doThan sit around and fuck my headHang out with the living deadSnort white shit up my nosePass out at the showsI don't even think about speedThat's something I just don't need  Straight Line by Wire (45secs), a band that Minor Threat covered (12XU)  The Beatles Mean Mr Mustard (67secs) Dig It & Maggie May are less than 60secs but Mean Mr Mustard is worth breaking the 60 second rule for. Her Majesty is a short one too.  Sgt Pepper’s Lonely Hearts Club Band (60secs) opens the posthumous Jimi Hendrix album In the West  Sports et Divertisements - Satie, this is all of the 20 short pieces for piano by Erik Satie  Kaini Industries by Boards of Canada (60secs) from one of the great electronica albums Music has the right to Children  Kim (edit) by Charlie Parker  Wasted by Black Flag (50secs) with Keith Morris on Vocals  Touched by My Bloody Valentine (57secs) from the peerless Loveless album  Kleenex - Hedi’s Head (61secs)  Ain’t Talkin About Love - Minutemen (45secs), a touching Van Halen cover  Amber by the Residents from their Commercial Album (62 seconds long) which features a whole load of tracks just over 60 secs long.  H.P. Lovecraft - Ban Deodorant - This is a a Radio ad but one of the best ones l’ve heard by a sixties band.  Frank Zappa & the Mothers of Invention - What’s the Ugliest Part of Your Body  Another source of many short songs Guided by Voices, this ones Evil Speakers  And finally who needs a whole minute? I like Short Songs - Dead Kennedys is 30 secs long

I posted this elsewhere, but Margo Price’s perfect 2016 debut album Midwest Farmer’s Daughter has a beautiful interlude titled World’s Greatest Loser. I still brace myself when my Spotify hits it. I’m pushing beyond one minute songs, but they all feel like short interludes rather than full songs. Patti Scialfa and her haunting little Black Ladder from 2007, no doubt penned to her husband Bruce Springsteen. Speaking of, Bruce and Patti closed 1992’s Human Touch album with Pony Boy — you could just cry. Lee Ann Womack opened her 2014 album The Way I’m Livin’ from the soul with Prelude: Fly. Patty Griffin opened 2007’s Impossible Dream with You’ll Remember, which segues to the rousing Stay on the Ride. Oh boy, Tori Amos and the opening to 1996’s Boys for Pele, Beauty Queen which connects to Blood Roses. Allison Moorer and 2010’s The Stars & I (Mama’s Song). Recently, Bat for Lashes with I Do, to open The Bride. Loretta Lynn and Jack White packed a lot into the short This Old House on Van Lear Rose (2004). Solange opened A Seat at the Table with Rise. Donna Summer and Love to Love You Baby. Just seeing if you’re paying attention. Laura Nyro and Labelle: I Met Him on a Sunday, and later on that same classic 1971 album (Gonna Take a Miracle) is the divine Desiree.
